greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: For all numbers k(n) congruent to +1 or -1 (mod 4) starting with k(n) = {3,5,7,9,11,...}, a(k(n)) is the congruence (mod 4) if k(n) is prime and 0 if k(n) is composite.
comment: Expression for k(n): k(n) = 4*ceiling(n/2) + (-1)^n, so the parity of n gives us the congruence (mod 4) of k(n). - _Daniel Forgues_, Mar 01 2009
link: Daniel Forgues, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..49999
xref: The absolute values of this sequence give A101264 (for n > 0.) The partial sums of this sequence give A156749. - _Daniel Forgues_, Mar 01 2009
results.author: _Daniel Forgues_, Feb 13 2009, Feb 14 2009
